p: Several studies have been conducted in order to verify the chemical composition and pharmacological effects of Baccharis genus extracts and fractions [ 6, 8, 9]. Phytochemical analyses have indicated the presence of a wide range of bioactive compounds, mainly polyphenols such as isoquercetin, apigenin, quercetin, rutin, and hispidulin [ 10]. These compounds are well-known as a consequence of their free-radical scavenging properties and for inhibiting lipid peroxidation [ 11].
